key_title: Key to the species of Hordeum

breadcrumbs.key_title: Key to the main groups of plants in Victoria
Key to the families of Monocotyledons
Key to the genera of Poaceae

leads.lead_text: Rachis breaking at each node at maturity; weedy species
Rachis remaining intact at maturity; cultivated species, rarely escaping
Annual; glumes lanceolate or subulate; awn of fertile lemma 10–35 mm long; widespread
Perennial; glumes all subulate; awn of fertile lemma 6–12 mm long; uncommon, naturalized between Swan Hill and Shepparton
Both glumes of central spikelet and inner glume of lateral spikelets lanceolate and ciliate, outer glume of lateral spikelets subulate
Glumes of central spikelet subulate and scabrous

Anthers of the central floret 0.2–0.5 mm long, usually blackish, less than half as long as those of lateral florets; article of rachis on which the triad of florets are united c. 2 mm long; leaves commonly glaucous
Anthers of central floret c. 1 mm long, usually pale, at least half as long as those of lateral florets; article of rachis 2.5 mm long or more; leaves green
Glumes of lateral spikelets similar, subulate or rarely linear-lanceolate; lower leaf-sheaths with hairs at least 0.5 mm long
Glumes of lateral spikelets dissimilar, the outer subulate, the inner lanceolate or winged near base; lower leaf-sheaths glabrous or with hairs not more than 0.5 mm long
All spikelets of all but the uppermost and lowermost triads fertile
All triads with the lateral pair of spikelets sterile
